There are many costs that Americans struggle with every day. The Build Back Better agenda is about helping people to cut those costs.

1472658733188755464.text: Every Senate Democrat supports giving our children the best opportunity to succeed possible starting with universal pre-K for 3- and 4-year olds. Great for our children and great for our economic future. We can act—we must act.

1472658327070990337.text: FACT: Too many parents pay more for their child care than their mortgage or rent. This is not only unsustainable but stops parents from going back to work. Every Senate Democrat supports capping the cost of child care at 7% of a working family’s income. We can act—we must act.

1472656985921363970.text: We agree Big Pharma’s price gouging must end. We can act—we must act.

1472656755452788737.text: We agree we should cap out-of-pocket costs at $2000 per year for seniors under Medicare. We can act—we must act.

1472656326501281794.text: We agree that the cost of insulin should be capped at $35 per month rather than the average $1,000 per month cost Americans pay now. We can act—we must act.

1406068303429312514.text: When Lt. Col. Kettles passed away, @RepDebDingell, @SenGaryPeters and I wanted to honor his life by renaming the Ann Arbor VA hospital in his honor. In 2020, Congress passed our bill to rename the VA Medical Center.

1406068302468747271.text: Because of his incredible bravery, In 2015, he was awarded the Medal of Honor, the highest military recognition. It was my honor to sponsor the Senate bill with @SenGaryPeters that helped make that happen.

1406068301667745794.text: Despite being in the line of fire, Lt. Col. Kettles rescued the remaining eight soldiers and flew the aircraft to safety.

1406068300627562512.text: On his final flight out of the area, he found out that eight soldiers were still on the ground. Without any support, he immediately returned to the deadly zone to rescue the remaining men. The enemies concentrated all of their fire on his helicopter.

1406068299360784393.text: I want to tell you the story of Lieutenant Colonel Kettles, a hero from Ypsilanti, Michigan. During the Vietnam War, Lt. Col. Kettles led three rescue flights into dangerous enemy territory to deliver supplies and reinforcements and to rescue 40 wounded soldiers. https://t.co/sLJBy0Ith8

1292512137580085251.text: President Trump and Mitch McConnell, instead of playing political games, get back to the negotiating table. And do your job!

1292512136430854144.text:
And they also understand that our small businesses and our family farmers need help to survive until we can safely reopen the economy.

Bottom line, we need a bold, bipartisan COVID-19 package that meets the needs of Americans across our country.

1292512135214489600.text: They also understand that millions of Michiganders need help right now to keep a roof over their heads, food on the table, pay their bills and safely send their children back to school.

1292512134128164867.text: Families in Michigan know that we have to have the testing and health care needed to tackle this pandemic and keep us safe.

1292512133108969476.text:
It is clear there’s a serious problem and families are losing their homes right now!

And, the President’s actions do nothing to provide funding to address the immediate worry of parents, teachers, and communities who are struggling with the decisions about re-opening schools.

1292512131892621314.text: In addition, he pretends to protect people who are renters. But his executive order doesn’t help a single American family facing eviction right now—he merely directs his own administration to ‘consider,’ to ‘identify,’ to ‘review.’

1292512130747568132.text: So President Trump says that if states want to help their citizens who are currently out of work, they have to lay off workers! That is just a cynical game and just plain cruel.

1292512129682214913.text: At the same time, he refuses to provide desperately needed funding for state and local services, jeopardizing the jobs of first responders, health care workers, and others involved in critical essential services for all of us.

1292512128625258499.text: Then, instead of just providing federal funding for $400 a week to people who are struggling to survive, he requires states to provide 25% of the funding.

1292512127878664192.text:
The President’s latest executive orders are another cruel political game pitting unemployed Americans against those providing essential state and local services. 

First, $400 per week is still a major cut in critically needed income for unemployed Americans.

1233784525119008769.text: A brilliant inventor, Elijah McCoy held over 50 U.S. patents. His incredible work has inspired generations of inventors, so much that the Midwest Regional U.S. Patent and Trademark office in Detroit is named after him! https://t.co/4cgunt7jNx

1233784521247657984.text: Clifton Wharton Jr. was a trailblazer for African-Americans in education. He was named @michiganstateu's first black President in 1970, making him the first black president of a major U.S. research university. https://t.co/jVnx1n5ExL

1233784517502087168.text: The first black school teacher in Flint, Lois Holt was committed to the civil rights movement. She and her husband mortgaged their home in 1957 to transport Flint residents to demonstrate in Alabama following Rosa Parks' arrest, giving a voice to those in her community. https://t.co/qnrApM54tW

1233784514293489664.text: Lem Tucker was the first black student body president at Central Michigan University. Tucker went on to be one of NBC's first black TV reporters in 1965 and won two Emmy Awards later in his career for his reporting of black America and hunger in the U.S. https://t.co/oy9ocOAynN

1233784509885288449.text: Otis M. Smith was a trailblazer in the legal community. As the first African-American appointed to the Michigan Supreme Court, Smith was a public servant who was very active in civic organizations. https://t.co/wvTivJRlNm

1233784505720242182.text:
Erma Henderson was the first black woman elected to the Detroit City Council in 1972. She fought for equality in the workplace and the judicial system.

Henderson led the effort to pass comprehensive state legislation to end the discriminatory practice of redlining in lending. https://t.co/yMgbNVXfTb

1233784502104788993.text: The Queen of Soul, Aretha Franklin, was a GRAMMY Award winner and recipient of the Presidential Medal of Freedom who impacted generations of Americans. A singer and civil rights activist from Detroit, Franklin's legacy extends beyond music. She is so loved and missed. https://t.co/TtNoQN38oc

999383129658941441.text: The VA Choice program was designed to make sure veterans can receive services close to home in a timely way but it has failed many of those it was intended to serve. Today we’re taking an important step to reform the VA program and improve care for our men & women in uniform.
